div1.p: This is a detailed clinical report from Africa, which describes a case of yellow fever in which the patient died. Included is a detailed description of the treatment program and the autopsy record.

div1.head: Report: Yellow Fever, October 31, 1922
div1.opener:
CLINICAL REPORT - YELLOW FEVER
_______________________________
NAME - G.A. Bradenelli. DATE OF ADMISSION - 31,10.22
SEX - Male - Age - 27 years. DATE OF DEATH - 9,11.22
NATIONALITY - Italian. DIAGNOSIS - Yellow Fever
OCCUPATION - Merchant. RESULT - D e a t h.
__________________________________________________________
div1.p:
HISTORY-
3/10/22.

Patient has been in Nigeria several years, principally in
Northern Nigeria. The present is his first tour in the Southern
Provinces at Warri. Health has been good, does not practise quinine
prophylaxis. On Sunday the 29th October, patient felt ill, severe
headache and general malaise all day with nausea.

Towards the evening he felt worse. Temperature taken by
himself 104.6. Severe frontal headache, loin pains and pains in his
eyes. Patient took 5 grs: quinine with 5 grs: Aspirin and an aperient
just at bed time. He had a very restless night, epigastric pain appear-
ed, accompanied by vomiting, at first contents of stomach, later bilious
in character. Next day 30th October he felt considerably worse with
severe frontal headache, backache, continuous vomiting. Temp: was
raised, - 104.6. Bowels only moved slightly, urine was freely passed
during this day. Very bad night, no sleep, severe headache, backache,
and epigastric pain, vomiting was worse, dark green bile, could not
retain anything. On the morning of the 31st as he felt very ill, I
was sent for at 12 noon and found him very ill, temp: 104, Pulse 72.
Face flushed, conjunctivae injected, vomiting present. From his appear-
ance I suspected more than a mere attack of malaria fever and had him
immediately removed to the Warri Hospital, although much against his
will.
ON ADMISSION. -

1:30 P.M. Patient perspiring freely, Temp: 102.4, P.90.
- 2 -
Complains of frontal headache, and backache, with aching pains in
limbs. Face flushed, eyes bright, conjunctivae injected. Lips and
mouth dry, great thirst, Sclerae slightly jaundiced.

ALIMENTARY SYSTEM - Vomiting present, bilious character. Epigastrium
very tender. Liver and spleen tender on palpation, both slightly en-
larged. Stomach intensely irritable. Vomits anything taken, vomit
consists of dark greenish bile.
CIRCULATORY SYSTEM - Pulse slow, low tension 90 mt: Heart sounds normal.

NERVOUS SYSTEM Severe frontal headache, aching pain in the loins and
limbs, mind quite clear.

URINARY SYSTEM - Urine had been freely passed the day before but none
passed since 10 P.M., last night (30th Oct.) At 2 P.M. patient passed
zt of bloody urine.

EXAMINATION Acid reaction - Blood present, Albumen present in large
amount. Casts present, hyaline as well as granular.

BLOOD EXAMINATION - Few malaria parasites present - subtertian,
Haemoglobin 85%. Polymorphonuclears numerous. No actual Leucocytosis.
Patient sponged, cold application to head and mustard leaf to epigastrium.
One pint normal saline solution given high up rectum and retained.
Calomel grs: IV in 1 gr: doses given hourly. Intramuscular injection
of quinine bihydrochlor grs; 6 given.

6. P.M. Patient more comfortable, no vomiting since application of mustard
leaf. Saline retained, and repeated 6 P.M. Cold barley water given
to allay thirst and retained. Temp: 101.8 P.80.

11. P.M. Patient vomited at 8:30 P.M., 4 ozs of dark green bile; mustard leaf
repeated to epigastrium. Bowels opened once. Yellow watery stool.
Temp: 101.4, P.80. at 10 P.M. Vomited again at 11, 2 ozs: green bile.
Passed 2 ozs urine at 10 P.M. dark yellow in colour, clearer.

EXAMINATION - No blood or haemoglobin, acid reaction, 1018 sp: gr:
Albumin present, Perspiring profusely.

1/11/22 Patient was quiet but did not sleep, retained his saline and all
fluids from 11 P.M. to 6 A.M. when vomiting again occurred, greenish
yellow bile. Bowels moved at 7.15 A.M.- large watery yellow offensive
motion. Passed 2 ozs: urine at 7:15 yellow in colour, acid reaction,
albumin present in large amount. Temp: (Rectal) 100. P. 72. Passed
1/2 oz: urine at 11, similar to last specimen, albumin present. Vomited
at 4:30 P.M. dark green bile. Retained his rectal salines, also
iced Champagne and Barley Water. Temp: at 6 P.M. 99.4 (Rectal) P.62
low tension. At 6 P.M. 1/2 oz of urine passed similar to last specimen.
At 9:30 P.M. patient vomited 10 oz of dark brown fluid, black debris
on standing. Very restless at 10:30 P.M. passed one drachm of urine -
cloudy, acid reaction, albumin present, no haemoglobin. Temp: at 10 P.M.
99.4. (Rectal) P.60.

2/11/22 Patient very restless, practically no sleep, had vomited at 1:15 A.M.
6 ozs of dark brown fluid with black debris. Retained his rectal salines.
Vomiting again occurred, similar to last specimen at 6 A.M. Thirst
intense, will only take small pieces of ice to suck. No urine passed
since 10:30 P.M. last night. Fermentations to loins continued. Mind
quite clear. No effort in vomiting, simply gushes out. Intravenous
saline 18 ozs; given at 10:15 A.M. Temp: at 9 A.M. 98.6 P.70.
Vomiting continued, dark brown fluid with black debris. Tongue is
clean and with red tip and edges. At 2 P.M. patient vomited 6 ozs
of black fluid, very heavy black deposit on standing. Temp: at 12:30
101 P.92 Sclerae show jaundice. Vomited again at 1:15, 8 ozs of
black fluid with debris. No urine passed at all, restlessness marked,
vomiting again occurred at 2,3, and 3:15 P.M., dark reddish fluid
- 4 -
with black deposit on standing. At 6 P.M. Catheter passed and 1 oz. of
urine obtained: Acid reaction, cloudy, albumin present - large amount:
T. 99, P.60. Hiccough appeared and was very distressing. Vomiting con-
tinued through the night, dark red fluid with black debris. Patient doz-
ing in the intervals. Temp: at 10 P.M. 99.4 P. 58. Epigastrium very
tender. Ice Pack to epigastrium retarded the hiccough for a time.

3/11/22 Patient very restless, hiccough and vomiting continued, sleep only pos-
sible at intervals. Vomited fluid is dark reddish black with black
debris on standing. No urine passed. Catheter passed at 12 noon and
only 1 oz of yellow pale cloudy urine obtained.

EXAMINATION - Acid, highly albuminous, No Bile. No haemoglobin or blood.
Esbach's Estimation of Albumin for 24 hours gave a result of 16 grms
albumen per oz :- 1% Hiccough very distressing, but vomiting causes no
effort. Solerae are pale yellow. Retains rectal salines. Intravenous
saline 16 ozs given at 3 P.M. stopped hiccough. Pulse improved 58 mt:
low tension. Temp at 6 P.M. 100.2, P. 55 Dozes at intervals. Hiccough
returned at 10:30.P.M. vomitting recommenced, dark reddish fluid 10 ozs.
at a time. Temp: at 10 P.M. 99., P.50.

4/11/22 Patient had a bad night, little sleep, hiccough and vomiting very dis-
tressing. Epigastric pain complained of. Tongue red and clean. Mind
quite clear. Temp: at 6 A.M. (rectal) 99.2 P. 50 low tension. No urine
since catheter passed yesterday. Catheter passed at 10. and 1"3/4 ozs
drawn off - similar to last specimen - yellow and cloudy. Acid, highly
albuminous. Retained the glucose and saline injections. Temp: at
6 P.M. 100., P.60 Very distressed, hiccough and vomiting continuous;
only ice to suck given to allay thirst. Sclerae yellow, complains of
burning pain in epigastrium. Ice applied. Vomited matter throughout
day varied from black to dark red with black debris on standing.

5/11/22 General condition same, no improvement, hiccough and vomiting continue.
No urine passed for 24 hours, Catheter passed at 10 A.M. and 3 1/2 ozs:
obtained, increased since last catheterisation due to Intravenous saline
16 ozs: Examination - Acid, pale, yellow, cloudy, No bile, albumin pres-
ent. Percentage for last 24 hours equals 3/4% equals 12 grs: albumin
per oz. Retains the rectal glucose and saline. Temp: at 6 A.M. - 100.,
P 58, at 2 P.M. 100.2., P. 60, and at 6 P.M., 99.8., P. 50. Temperature
taken rectally owing to the fact that iced fluid and ice was taken by
the mouth. Axillary temp: is 1° lower than rectal. Vomited matter con-
sisted of black slightly acid fluid varying from 8 to 10 ozs and occurring
nearly every hour or oftener sometimes. Bowel washed out with large
warm saline. Very distressed and restless. Mind quite clear.

6/11/22 General condition much the same, hiccough and vomiting still present de-
spite all treatment attempted. At 2 A.M. and again at 3 bowels moved -
dark red offensive fluid. Temp: at 6 A.M. 98.8 P.60. No urine passed
all yesterday since catheter passed at 11 A.M. 4 1/2 ozs. of cloudy urine
drawn off (an increase on last quantity).

EXAMINATION - Faintly acid. Sp. Gr: 1008. No blood, albumin present.
Estimation for last 24 hours 8 grs per oz - 1/2%. Pulse bad, injection
of camphor in oil given at 11:45 A.M. Improved later. At 6 P.M., con-
dition unchanged. Hiccough despite treatment, very distressing and pract-
ically continuous. Vomiting every half hour. Calcium Chloride grs 15
added to Rectal Saline, retained, Temp: at 2 P.M., 100., P. 60 low
tension at 11 P.M. pulse irregular. Inject Strychnine P. 56., T. 100.

7/11/22 Condition very bad but mind quite clear, slept for only 1/2 hour during
the night. Hiccough constant. Vomiting practically every hour 4 to 8 ozs:
dark brown fluid. Petechial haemorrhage appeared on arms and scrotum and
under finger nails - also seen on M.M. of mouth. Haemorrhages from gums.
- 6 -
No urine passed. Intravenous Injection Saline at 9 A.M., 16 oz.
Catheter passed at 9:30 and 5 3/4 ozs. of urine drawn off. Pale yellow,
very cloudy, faintly acid. - Sp: Gr: 1010, highly albuminous. No bile.
Estimation of Albumin for previous 24 hours - 6 grs: per oz: 10 A.M.
patient quieter. Temp: 99., P.66. Hiccough not so distressing. At
2:30 P.M. vomiting recommended - dark reddish brown fluid, Black Debris.
Hypo-Injection Ernutin m: 10 repeated in 4 hours. Bowels began to move
and by 10.10 P.M. three dark red offensive stools passed. No urine since
last catheterisation. Temp: at 6 P.M. 99., 4., P. 70.

8/11/22 Patient had a restless night, dozed at intervals after Bromide and Chloral
Injection given at 2 P.M. yesterday. Hiccough very distressing, vomiting
still continues despite any treatment. Retains the rectal saline and
glucose given 4 hourly. Temp: at 6 A.M. 99., P. 66 low tension. Catheter
Passed at 10 A.M. 11 ozs: of urine drawn off - pale yellow, cloudy, faint-
ly acid. No bile. Albumin present. Estimation of albumin for 24 hours
4 grains per oz:, Vomited matter consists of dark red fluid. Bowels moved -
large reddish brown offensive watery motion, General Condition bad, pulse
low tension, Patient dozed from 3 to 3:30 P.M. Mind very clear. At 11 P.M.
catheter again passed and 5 ozs: of urine drawn off similar in character
to last specimen. Pulse 65. Very low tension. Injection of Stryohnine.
.0002 grm given.

9/11/22 Patient dozed for a short period but hiccough and vomiting began again at
1 P.M. Very restless and irritable. Subsultus Tendinum present. Temp:
at 2 A.M. 97 (axillary) 98 (rectal) P. 72 irregular. Hiccough distress-
ing. At 2:30 A.M. a petechial rash appeared. Haemorrhages from gums.
Bowels moving - dark red offensive motions. At 6 A.M. Temp: 96 (axillary)
rectal 97. Skin cold and clammy. Sclerae yellow. At 10 A.M. general
condition the same. Mind perfectly clear. Vomiting continuous - dark
red fluid. Catheter passed and 6 ozs: of cloudy yellow urine drawn off.

EXAMINATION - Faintly soid Sp: Gr: 1010 albumin present. Petechial
haemorrhages on M.M. of mouth and in skin over thorax. Injection
Digitalis. .0001 grm: Tongue clean and red. Quite conscious. Vomit-
ing and hiccough continued, dark reddish brown fluid, faintly acid.
At 12 noon general condition became very bad. Pulse irregular. Temp:
96.4 very restless. At 3 P.M. convulsions came on, not violent, and
death took place at 3:30 P.M.

div1.p: POST MORTEM RECORD.
Post Mortem Examination performed 2 hours after death - 5:30 P.M.

row.cell:
Very sallow. Hypostatic congestion very marked on all dependent
parts. Ecchymosis of scrotum marked. Petechial haemorrhages present
on arms and thighs. Sclerae pale yellow.
Had not begun. Subcutaneous tissue pale yellow.

Weight 11 ozs. Ventricles contracted. Valves normal. Pericardium
contained 2 ozs. of clear fluid.
Weight 24 ozs. Normal in appearance and section.
Weight 23 1/2 ozs. Normal in appearance and section.
Normal. A little clear fluid present in each cavity.
Normal, Small petechial haemorrhages seen in m.m. of Trachea
Normal. Abdominal cavity contained 6 ozs. clear fluid.

Externally - showed congestion. Internally M. Membrane intensely con-
gested and thrown into folds. Haemorrhages present all over, particular-
ly at Oesophageal and Pyloric openings and along greater curvature. 4 ozs
of thick dark red gelatinous fluid present.

Duedenum intensely congested. M. Membrane shows intense congestion and
haemorrhagic areas. Ileum in the same condition. Contents - dark brown
offensive fluid.

Congested in patches externally. M. Membraneeappears normal. Contents -
dark brownish red offensive fluid.

Enlarged. Weight 70 ozs. Mottled appearance externally. Small yellow
areas. On section pale yellowish in parts. Greasy on section.
Distended. 2 ozs. of dark green bile present. No stones.

Enlarged. Weight 18 1/2 ozs. very dark in colour. Soft on section
shows a distinct mottled appearance.
Enlarged. Weight 9 1/4 ozs Capsule strips. On section, Cortex pale.
Enlarged. Weight 9 ozs. Similar to Right Kidney.

Contracted. M. M. congested. Contains 1 oz yellow cloudy urine.
Faintly acid. Albumin present. Microscopic examination - Casts
present.
